channel.title: 90s-Vibes on My Awesome Blog
channel.description: Recent content in 90s-Vibes on My Awesome Blog

item.title: Hello World: First Post on the New Site
item.description:
Welcome to the new site! If you’re reading this, you’ve survived the assault on your retinas that is my color palette. Congratulations.

Why Hugo?

Because sometimes you want your blog posts to be plain text files that you can read in any editor, version control with git, and know will still be readable in 20 years.

Also it’s fast. Like, absurdly fast.

What’s next?

  • More posts, probably
  • Maybe some actual content instead of placeholder text
  • Tweaking these colors until they’re just right

“Any sufficiently advanced color palette is indistinguishable from a fever dream.” â€” Me, just now

item.title: On Design Choices (Or: Why Does This Site Look Like a Lisa Frank Trapper Keeper?)
item.description:
Everyone’s doing clean, minimal, Helvetica-on-white websites these days. And that’s fine. Those sites are perfectly readable and professional and boring as hell.

The case for chaos

Remember when the web was fun? When every Geocities page had a different background GIF and at least three “Under Construction” signs? When choosing a color palette meant “all of them”?

I’m not saying we should go back to <blink> tags and auto-playing MIDI files. But maybe we overcorrected.
